Recibi esto:

-------- Original Message --------

You are invited to participate in Imagine Cup 2004, a worldwide competition
sponsored by Microsoft Corporation. This is the second year the
competition is running, with the top prize being a cash gift of $25,000
and a trip to Brazil for the awards ceremony.

This is an excellent opportunity to get involved in development of an
independent project, both for personal skill growth and for attaining a
greater set of qualities cherished by your future employers. Any college
and even high school students can participate -- feel free to tell about
the contest to any of your friends who may be interested.

The contest entries can belong to one of the following categories:

 * Software Design
Enter in teams of up to four to design a smart software system/application
that improves the quality of everyday life. Specifically, the entries being
sought are Microsoft .NET applications that contain a mobile device, a smart
component, and create and use at least one web service.

 * Rendering
This invitational seeks entries from the growing field of
computer-generated graphics (static or interactive animation) using
Microsoft Visual Studio� .NET and DirectX� 9.0. Groups of up to four
individuals can participate.

 * Short Film
This category highlights the creation of digital videos that share
perspectives on the culture of innovation. Teams of up to four individuals can
participate.

 * Algorithm
This online, individual and timed competition calls for entrants to
demonstrate quick thinking and coding skills using Microsoft programming
languages such as Visual Basic� .NET, Visual J#� .NET, Visual C#� .NET or
Visual C++� .NET. You need access to a computer connected to the Internet
and 30 free minutes between March 15 and April 1, 2004. The challenge
covers a variety of technical questions revolving around mathematical and
computer science concepts. You must compete as an individual.

The official web page of the contest is http://www.imaginecup.com. At the
site you can learn more about each contest category, read answers to frequently
asked questions, and register for the contest. Please be sure to check it
out, and consider participating in the contest! The contest rules,
including deadlines, are also available at the page
http://www.imaginecup.com/contestrules.aspx


-- 
Sebastian Enrique
Graduate Research Assistant           
Columbia University
